page.title: 01BURTON HALL FARM
page.content:
Burton Hall Farm - this farm is an arable farm of 550 acres. The land is flat and forms part of the Vale of York. There is no livestock on this farm and the most important crop is wheat. The soils are mainly sandy loam, blowing sand and medium loam, which suits wheat. Sugar beet from the farm is taken to the processing factory at York, potatoes are used for crisps, swedes are taken to the wholesale market and oil seed rape and corn are sent to merchants. { The farm is owned by Mr Huddlestone and is managed by Mr Nicholson.
There aren't many workers on the farm as much of the work is done by machines.
